name: Prediction
overview:
This class allows you interact with Prediction API.

google-cloud is deprecated

Due to the scope of our API rapidly increasing, you may notice a decrease in performance if you continue to use the bundled module, google-cloud.

Going forward, please install only the individual service modules that you need, such as @google-cloud/prediction.

First, install google-cloud with npm:

$ npm install --save google-cloud

If you are running your app on Google Compute Engine, you won't need to worry about supplying connection configuration options to google-cloudâ€” we figure that out for you.

However, if you're running your app elsewhere, you will need to provide project details to authenticate API requests.

Google Cloud Platform

var gcloud = require('google-cloud'); var prediction = gcloud.prediction();

Elsewhere

var gcloud = require('google-cloud'); var prediction = gcloud.prediction({ projectId: 'grape-spaceship-123', keyFilename: '/path/to/keyfile.json' });

The full set of options which can be passed to google-cloud are outlined in our Authentication guide.

methods.name: Prediction
methods.description:
The Google Prediction API provides pattern-matching and machine learning capabilities. Given a set of data examples to train against, you can create applications that can perform the following tasks:

  • Given a user's past viewing habits, predict what other movies or products a user might like.
  • Categorize emails as spam or non-spam.
  • Analyze posted comments about your product to determine whether they have a positive or negative tone.
  • Guess how much a user might spend on a given day, given his spending history.

resources.title: What is the Google Prediction API?

methods.name: createModel
methods.description:
Create a trained model.

You may optionally provide a storage/file as a data source to train the new model. If you have a CSV file, but haven't put it in a bucket yet, you will need to reference a bucket with storage/bucket, a file with storage/file, and upload it with storage/file#upload.

examples.caption: Create a model, using an existing CSV file in a Cloud Storage bucket as training data.
If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: options
params.description: • See the Trainedmodels: insert API Documentation request body.

params.name: options.data
params.description: • A CSV file to use as training data.

params.name: options.type
params.description: • The type of model, classification (categorical, text labels) or regression (numeric labels). Learn more about these options in the Developers Guide.

exceptions.description: If a model ID is not provided.

methods.name: getModels
methods.description: Gets a list of trained models for the project.

examples.caption: To control how many API requests are made and page through the results manually, set autoPaginate to false.
If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: query.maxApiCalls
params.description: • Maximum number of API calls to make.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request

methods.name: getModelsStream
methods.description: Gets a list of prediction/model objects for the project as a readable object stream.

examples.caption: If you anticipate many results, you can end a stream early to prevent unnecessary processing and API requests.

params.name: query
params.description: • Configuration object. See prediction#getModels for a complete list of options.

methods.name: model
methods.description: Create a model object representing a trained model.

params.name: id
params.description: • The unique ID of the trained model.

exceptions.description: If a model ID is not provided.
